plugins.name: Pixelate
plugins.description:
ğŸ¨ Draw, design, and playâ€”one pixel at a time.


Pixelate is a free simple tool where you can paint, customize colors, and export your pixel creations effortlessly. Whether youâ€™re sketching a retro-style pixel art, patterns, or just having fun, I hope pixelate makes it easy to bring your ideas to life!


How it works,


Double-click any color to customize ğŸ¨, use the Brush or the Paint Bucket to fill areas ğŸª£, and click Save to export your drawing ğŸ’¾.


Some thoughts,


  1. Change grid sizes to match your creative vision.
  2. Reset your drawing using the Clear button or by adjusting the grid size.
  3. Select and edit pixels directly in Figma to fine-tune your design.
  4. Build in smaller chunks to create intricate, large-scale masterpieces.


If you run into any glitches, let me know! I'm always open to feedback and feature ideas. ğŸš€

Main features of PMF by Morisawa Fonts


Use of high-quality fonts

  1. Fonts can be obtained from Morisawa's font service and converted to paths, allowing them to be reflected in designs.
  2. Professional standard typefaces and design typefaces loved by designers, such as UD Shin Go, Ryumin, and Gothic MB101, can be used.


Character attribute settings

  1. In addition to font selection, you can also adjust simple typography settings such as character spacing and proportionality
  2. It also has a vertical writing function (beta version), which supports typography for vertical videos such as reels.


Collaboration through text path creation and restoration

  1. The software is equipped with a function that converts text into paths in SVG format. It is possible to restore the text that has been converted into paths in Figma to its original state, which supports flexible design changes and sharing, and accelerates collaboration.
  2. The exported materials can also be used in other design tools and platforms.

Main features of PMF by Morisawa Fonts


Use of high-quality fonts

  1. Fonts can be obtained from Morisawa's font service and converted to paths, allowing them to be reflected in designs.
  2. Professional standard typefaces and design typefaces loved by designers, such as UD Shin Go, Ryumin, and Gothic MB101, can be used.


Character attribute settings

  1. In addition to font selection, you can also adjust simple typography settings such as character spacing and proportionality
  2. It also has a vertical writing function (beta version), which supports typography for vertical videos such as reels.


Collaboration through text path creation and restoration

  1. The software is equipped with a function that converts text into paths in SVG format. It is possible to restore the text that has been converted into paths in Figma to its original state, which supports flexible design changes and sharing, and accelerates collaboration.
  2. The exported materials can also be used in other design tools and platforms.

plugins.name: Figma Token Manager - Reorder Variable Modes
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to drag and drop reorder your variable modes in your collections. Select a collection to fetch all the variables it contains. After your tokens loaded, you can reorder your collection modes by drag and drop. Once your are satisfied with the result, hit "Save changes" and your modes' order will get updated.


Features

  • Load tokens from your Figma file
  • Select from your collections
  • Reorder variable modes in selected collection


This plugin comes with 5 free trials, after which you'll be prompted to purchase a license key for a one-time payment to enjoy the plugin without limits.
plugins.tagline: Reorder your Figma variable modes using drag and drop.

plugins.name: Oscill
plugins.description:
Transform any vector path in your Figma document into a wave with frequency, amplitude, fade in/out and more defined by you. Choose from a set of different waveforms: Sine, Triangle and Square.


1) Draw or select a vector path. (works with other shapes too).


2) Click on â€˜Syncâ€™ button.


3) Play.


4) Click â€˜Syncâ€™ again every time you select or modify a path.


-> Your generated wave will adapt to the new selected path.


5) Click on the â€˜Placeâ€™ button.


-> Your shape will get the same styling as the selected object and will be placed over it.


---------------------------------------------------------------

You can buy me a coffee.



Thank you!

plugins.name: Views
plugins.description:
Bookmark the important parts of your file

Views lets you organize and present your work.


"A must-have plugin for navigating large files and showing work to others." @dnlbtlr


Here is a great step-by-step by @chris_lueders_


How to create views

  1. Position and zoom any part of your file
  2. Hit + to save view


How to view your err... views:

  1. Hit â†± beside the view name
  2. Double-click view
  3. Hit â–¶ï¸ to present
  4. Hide/show any view from presentation by clicking on ğŸ”µ


Main features:

  1. Save views anywhere in your file so you can go back to them with one click (or 2 if you prefer). It remembers position and zoom level
  2. Organize views and name them whatever you'd like (you can use ğŸ’© too
  3. Group views anyway you want, like a group for each team member (I hope you are not more than 3 :-D), category or version...
  4. Present views with compact controls and keyboard navigation (and now with custom background color)
  5. Hide from presentation any views you want to have saved but not included when presenting
  6. Smooth transitions navigating between views to impress you, your friends, your cat and your clients
  7. Use it without the UI using Quick Actions you can jump from view to view just by using shortcuts (like âŒ¥ âŒ˜ P)

plugins.name: @sposhe/poisson
plugins.description:
Poisson

Generates a random distribution of one or more elements a minimum distance apart. Optionally randomizes rotation.


How to Use

  1. Create a frame
  2. Add one or more elements to the frame (these can be shapes, component instances, or other frames)
  3. Select the frame
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Set a minimum distance threshold (and optionally set if rotation should be randomized)
  6. Press the "Create" button


How it Works

The plugin creates a new frame beside the source frame, and draws copies of the source element(s) using the poisson-disc distribution algorithm until the frame is filled. If more than one source element is used, the source element for each node is chosen randomly.


Under the Hood

The plugin uses Beau Gunderson's poisson-disk-sampler javascript package, which is based on Mike Bostock's implementation of Jason Davies' implementation of Bridson's algorithm. View Mike Bostock's great explanation of how poisson-disc sampling works.
plugins.tagline: Generates a random distribution of one or more elements a minimum distance apart.

plugins.name: DataPocket
plugins.description:
Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma


Elevating design systems with DataPocket and Figma integration

DataPocket seamlessly integrates with Figma, enabling designers to access real-time data within their design environment. This integration streamlines workflows, ensures consistency, and enhances collaboration by incorporating live data directly into design systems.

Seamless integration into any design system

Consistent and centralized data access across design projects

Real-time updates and synchronization of data within design systems


Increased efficiency in prototyping and testing with accurate, real data

Enhanced scalability and collaboration to accommodate growing design requirements

Improved decision-making through data-driven design insights


More about the Plugin:


Real Time data access 

Access real-time data from sources like WooCommerce, Shopify, and more, directly within Figma. Streamline collaboration, boost productivity, and unlock new creative possibilities with DataPocket.


DataPocket for Figma Teams

Work cross functionally with different teams/businesses without having to worry about using the correct/relevant product data. DataPocket continuously updates product data from the source so everyone has access to the most up to date data. Gone are the days of having to redo a mock up or piece of content because the wrong information was used.


Data Sources always up-to-date

DataPocket formats all Product data allowing it to be used for drag and drop on design platforms like Figma and Canva allowing teams to easily drag and drop any modifications to the product and update their designs/mockups in seconds.
plugins.tagline: Integrate your data feeds and eCommerce products directly into Figma

plugins.name: Swift Colors
plugins.description:
Swift Colors is a simple plugin for exporting color tokens to a Swift color theme.


Features


  • Map color tokens in Figma to a type-safe Swift color theme file automatically.


  • Define light and dark mode color behaviour directly from Figma, by organising your color tokens in light and dark mode palettes.


How to use


1. Prepare your file's color tokens

Organise color styles into a light and dark mode color palette in the Color Styles panel. Figma color styles can be organised in groups by prefixing the color style name with the group name.


For example: 

"Light Mode/Buttons/Primary"

"Dark Mode/Buttons/Primary"


If you don't have a dark mode color palette yet, the plugin will use the light mode palette for dark mode too.


2. Export

Export the .swift file to your Xcode project.


3. Use in Xcode

Use your color theme by calling the desired color token name in your code. 


For example:

button.backgroundColor = Buttons.primary


4. See it in action!

If you have defined both a light and dark mode color palette that contains a color style for Buttons.primary, iOS will automatically change between the two variants based on the user's preference.


Why it works


The exported theme file includes an extension on UIColor that automatically adapts to light and dark mode variants based on the current UITraitCollection.

plugins.name: Tally
plugins.description:
Quickly tally stamp votes for stickys!


Select everything you want to tally up (including the stickys and stamps) and run the plugin. It will add a visual tally count to the bottom right of every sticky for everyone to see.


Notes:

  • Don't worry if the selection contains other types of components, they won't affect the tally. Just drag a big rectangle selection over the entire area and let Tally handle the rest!
  • You will need to re-select and run the plugin every time new stamps are added that you want to include in the count
  • Stamps do not need to be directly on a sticky for them to be counted. If a stamp is part of the selection, it will count towards the sticky that it's closest to

â€¢ Choose to fix specific modules, such as a selected screen or an entire page, according to your needs.


3. Create and Enhance Components

â€¢ Scan entire pages to detect all major components, resulting in a new component kit made from the screens on the page.

â€¢ Get all possible variants and states of components generated, with properties automatically assigned to their respective elements.



ğŸ˜« The Problem


Creating and maintaining design systems is painful:

â€¢ Manually creating variables for colors, typography, and spacing takes hours.

â€¢ Ensuring consistency across existing designs is tedious and error-prone.

â€¢ Updating old files to match new brand guidelines is a nightmare.

â€¢ Building component libraries and design kit from scratch requires weeks of work.



âœ¨ The Solution


Bloq automates the entire process:

1. Input: Pick a figma file and run Bloq on it.

2. Analyze: Our AI examines your design patterns.

3. Generate: Get a complete, variablized component kit in minutes.

4. Update: Modify existing designs with one click.

ğŸ’ª Perfect For

â€¢ Companies: Modernizing design infrastructure without hassle.

â€¢ Time-Savers: Anyone looking to save hours on design system creation.

Ready to revolutionize your design workflow? Try Bloq today and experience the future of design system creation!

Our technology captures the way your enterprise communicates, aligns your content with your guidelines, shortens your editorial process with automation, and analyzes the performance of your entire content operation.


Get customers faster, keep them longer, and reduce risks in communication.


As you write, the Acrolinx Sidebar guides you to create content thatâ€™s aligned with your strategy. Acrolinx ensures youâ€™re using the words and phrases that are relevant to your company tone of voice and the audience youâ€™re trying to reach. See where your content is strong and where it could be stronger with a detailed Acrolinx Scorecard and Analytics insights.


Acrolinx is not a stand-alone authoring tool. Itâ€™s an enterprise tool, which requires a paid existing Acrolinx account. If your company doesnâ€™t have Acrolinx installed (or youâ€™re not sure) weâ€™d love to help you learn more.


Visit www.acrolinx.com to discover how you can supercharge your content.
77223.release_notes:
In this release, we've improved how Acrolinx reads formatting for paragraphs and lists.

Improvements
More contextual information - The text content of Figma nodes now comes with more contextual information, including details about the structure of paragraphs and lists. We've updated Acrolinx to align with this and improve checking behavior. Get the updated Figma Content Profile to benefit from these changes.

plugins.name: blokdots
plugins.description:
blokdots is a simple to use software to build interactive hardware prototypes without a line of code.


With this plugin you can connect Figma to the blokdots app (--> download at blokdots.com), making it possible to use hardware components like sensors and buttons to control and manipulate elements right in Figma. This means it is now possible to bridge the gap between hardware and UI prototypes!


â€” What you can do

You can use hardware components to set the text, color, size, rotation or position of Figma layers and map the values of your sensors to the color, size, rotation or position of a layer.


â€” How to use the Plugin

In the blokdots app, go to â€œConnect A New Componentâ€ and select â€œFigmaâ€ to add the integration to your project.


Then run the blokdots Plugin in Figma. Select the layer you want to be able to manipulate with your hardware prototype and press the â€œExpose to blokdotsâ€ button in the Plugin window.


You can now select â€œFigmaâ€ as a component in any card in blokdots, select one of the layers you exposed and define how it should respond.


When you run your project in blokdots, make sure the blokdots plugin in Figma is running as well. blokdots and Figma will connect automatically and you can now manipulate Figma layers right from your hardware prototype!


â€” Requirements

To use this plugin you need to â€¦

â€¢ have the latest version of the blokdots app installed and running --> download at blokdots.com

â€¢ have an Arduino microcontroller set up

â€¢ use the Figma Desktop version

plugins.name: Tokens to Tailwind CSS
plugins.description:
This plugin generates utility classes for Tailwind CSS from design tokens set in the local style of Figma.


Instructions

  1. Create a local styles.
  2. Run this plugin.
  3. Select some options and press generate button.
  4. Copy and paste the generated code into the Tailwind CSS configuration file.


*Currently only colour styles are supported.


Options

ãƒ»Primitive colours

Generates the primitive styles referenced by the semantic style as CSS variables.


ãƒ»Classify by keys

Classify by key if a special name is used for the first level of the style name.


Find out more:

Determining the colours can be the most challenging thing to start a project, especially a project that begins only based on the logo provided by the client.

plugins.name: PWA Icons And Splash Generator
plugins.description:
"PWA Icons and Splash Generator" is a versatile Figma plugin designed to simplify the process of creating Progressive Web App (PWA) icons and splash screens. With this powerful tool at your disposal, you can effortlessly generate all the necessary assets required to make your web application visually appealing, responsive, and ready for a wide range of devices.

Key Features:

  • Icon and Splash Screen Variations: The plugin allows you to generate a variety of icon sizes and splash screens, catering to different screen resolutions and device dimensions. It includes standard sizes commonly used for PWAs.
  • Custom Background Color: You have the flexibility to define a custom background color for your splash screens, ensuring they seamlessly match your app's branding and design.

Whether you're a seasoned web developer or a designer looking to streamline your PWA design process, this plugin empowers you to create a polished and professional user experience by simplifying the generation of icons and splash screens. It's an invaluable addition to your Figma toolkit for PWA design and development.
plugins.tagline: Generate Icons And Splash screen

plugins.name: Localize
plugins.description:
Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes


Let your designs speak for themselves. Effortlessly translate your Figma creations into other languages.


Showcase your designs in front of the largest audience possible. Localize seamlessly integrates with Figma allowing you to amplify your workâ€™s impact by making it accessible to more people and languages.


Unlike run-of-the-mill translators, Localize offers designers an easy and elegant solution that:


  1. Takes the hassle out of internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) processes
  2. Automates and streamlines localization workflows right in the design phase
  3. Reduces content translation complexities by eliminating the need for development resources
  4. Maximizes ROI by speeding up time to market


Localize empowers you to create globally-inclusive UI and UX designs, expanding the appeal and reach of your work by presenting them in the languages of your target markets.


Localization as easy as 1, 2, 3


  1. Install Plugin. Go to the Community section on Figmaâ€™s website. Select Plugins and use the search functionality to locate Localize. Select Install on the top-right corner of the Localize plugin page.
  2. Connecting to Localize. Once installed, access Localize via the Plugins dropdown.
  3. Enter your API Key. Start a Localize free trial or integrate with your Localize Business plan (or higher) by entering the API key.


I already have a Localize Advanced plan or higher account:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Type in your Localize API key. Select Connect.


I donâ€™t have a Localize account yet:


  1. Install the Localize plugin in Figma.
  2. Open your Figma file.
  3. Hover over Plugins in the toolbar. Select Localize.
  4. Click the Start Your Free Trial link on the bottom of the login view.
  5. Create a Localize account and follow the Localize install steps.
  6. Return to Figma and type in your Localize API key. Then, select Connect.


If your organization doesn't have an Advanced plan, please click to upgrade your plan!


Need help?


For more information and to learn how to install the plugin, visit our Help Docs


Donâ€™t have a Localize account? Try it for free!
plugins.tagline: Localize Your Figma Designs in Minutes

plugins.name: Color wheel
plugins.description:
A color wheel is a circular representation of colors, typically made up of 12 hues. It's a fundamental tool in many fields like art, design, and printing, as it helps us understand how colors relate to each other.


RYB (Red, Yellow, Blue): This is the traditional painters' color wheel used for mixing physical paints.


RGB (Red, Green, Blue): This is the color model used for displays like TVs and computer screens.


CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black): This is the color model used for printing.

plugins.name: ShapesXR
plugins.description:
Bring your Figma designs to life in XR with the ShapesXR Figma Plugin! Effortlessly export multiple frames or objects simultaneously and neatly organize them in folders. Any updates made in Figma are automatically synced in both XR and web apps, ensuring seamless iterations with just one export.


ShapesXR increases the speed and efficiency of the design/development pipeline by bringing designers together with their developers and product owners in the immersive medium for spatial design and review. Whether you're on a desktop or using a headset, enjoy full compatibility with Quest 2, Quest 3, Quest Pro, Pico 4, and Pico 4 Pro.


Use ShapesXR today and create your free account!

plugins.name: Define
plugins.description:
Define takes a single layer/group/frame/component/instance, finds out what it contains and gives you the specs for all supported objects it finds. While Define works on complex objects with many nested layers, it works best if you use it to Define individual components.


Currently it reports the following specs:

  • Text layers: font family, size, line height, color and opacity
  • Shapes: corner radius, fill color, stroke color, stroke width, stroke alignment and opacity
  • Effects: drop shadow

plugins.name: Print Resizer
plugins.description:
This plugin collects all components from frames in the current figma page and then copies and rearranges them into new printable frames. The printable frames can then be exported and printed on regular letter head. This plugin is especially helpful for frames with auto-layout since they can only scale in only one direction, making printing difficult.


Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

plugins.name: Snapattern - Seamless pattern generator
plugins.description:
Snappattern - Turn anything into dynamic patterns


Snapattern lets you transform any layer â€” shapes, text, icons, images, frames â€” into generative, customisable patterns inside Figma. With simple, powerful controls, you can create visually stunning repeated patterns for backgrounds, branding, illustrations, and more in just a few clicks.


Playground File : This file has 50 patterns generated using this plugin and can be used for background, abstracts arts and social media visuals.


Key Features :


  1. Any Shapes, text layers, images, icons, groups, and frames - anything can be selected and be generated as a pattern.
  2. Supports Repeat, grid based patterns.
  3. Ability to generate patterns based on components/instances.
  4. Adjust opacity for layering effects
  5. Add rotation for circular effects
  6. Adjust directions for patterns
  7. Scale elements to add depth and variations.


Pricing :


Free : Up to 10 free pattern generations to explore and test the plugin.

Premium : Unlimited pattern generations at a price of coffee.


Future :


Instance based pattern generations planned for now - Shipped

accepted.name: Briston
accepted.description: Designer | Student | webflow
